titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Housing Works Cannabis Co. Ephemera Collection
2022 MS 3226
titlestmt.author: Paul-Louis Biondi (June 2023)

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:48:46 -0400.

did.unittitle: Housing Works Cannabis Co. Ephemera Collection
did.abstract: The Housing Works Cannabis Co. Ephemera Collection consists of approximately 24 pieces of ephemera related to the opening of the first licensed cannabis store in the state of New York. The materials include the receipt for the first sale from December 29, 2022, various pamphlets and information on safe drug use, and packaging for products sold in store.
did.physloc: This collection is stored offsite. For information on making arrangements to consult it, please see www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The material in this collection is in English.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Additional accruals are expected in this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged by material type.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Housing Works Cannabis Co. (HWCC), a branch of Housing Works, Inc., first opened to the public on December 29, 2022 at 750 Broadway near Astor Place. Through the Seeding Opportunity Initiative, approved by New York Governor Kathy Hochul in March 2022, HWCC received the first Cannabis Adult-Use Retail Dispensaries (CUARD) license in the state. The Seeding Opportunity Initiative seeks to establish socially equitable businesses. Sasha Nutgent, the retail manager of the Broadway store, stated that HWCC operates within a harm reduction framework with a focus on social equity models in their hiring practices and support of those disproportionately affected by cannabis prohibition. Additionally, the CEO of Housing Works, Inc., Charles King, stated at the opening that HWCC would seek to elevate products from LGBTQ+, BIPOC, and women-led cannabis businesses in New York State. As a branch of Housing Works Inc., all proceeds from HWCC go to supporting the company's mission to address both homelessness and HIV/AIDS through advocacy, education, its various services, and its businesses like HWCC that enable such work. Founded in 1990, Housing Works Inc. offers a wide variety of services such as comprehensive housing and healthcare, legal services and advocacy, and a "Ready for Work" program. Both Housing Works Inc. and Housing Works Cannabis Co. aim to uplift communities who have suffered under the war on drugs via their direct action and advocacy.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open to all qualified researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff. Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282. Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: www.nyhistory.org/rights-and-reproductions.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Andrew Greene, Chief Operating Officer of Housing Works Inc., February 28, 2023.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Housing Works Cannabis Co. Ephemera Collection, MS 3226, The New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Paul-Louis Biondi, the N-YHS intern for Princeton Internships in Civic Service (PICS), July 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Donated by the Chief Operating Officer of Housing Works, Andrew Greene, the collection of ephemera includes product packages, Housing Works merchandise, business cards, a full menu of the cannabis products offered in-store, pamphlets regarding safe drug use and harm reduction, and Housing Works posters. Featured in the collection as well are the New York State Office of Cannabis Management and Gossamer, a cannabis lifestyle magazine. All material dates from 2022.
